Articles.Content:
The goal of the challenge is very simple. Collide with Kerbol (Just get destroyed by it, you don't have to hit it). HOWEVER! You must use the DEMO version of KSP! You CANNOT use the full version of KSP.

Requirements:

A picture of the title screen.

A picture of the rocket in the VAB.

A picture of the rocket on the Launchpad

A picture of the map view showing a Kerbol orbit.

A picture of the rocket dangerously close to Kerbol.

This shouldn't be all too hard, right?

(FOR NOOBS: Kerbol=Sun)

Edited November 10, 2015 by The Flame Cat

It might turn out to be harder than you think. Kerbol obliterates anything that gets within a couple thousand kilometers of the surface. You can get an impact trajectory without too much difficulty, but you'll never get close to an actual collision.
Just get destroyed by it, I meant EDITING!
This is easy to do in the new demo - the old one was impossible because there was no kerbol, only a point of light, so one could fly into it. Those were the days.....
